children.subject: The form appears when you attempt to enroll in conflicting classes.

Also, I am currently waitlisted in this course and will be for Phase 1 so when I tried to enroll in a conflicting time it just put me on the waitlist so I don't see any form. How should I handle that?

Are you enrolled in one of the classes? If so, per the linked instructions, if you attempt to enroll in two classes that have a time schedule overlap, a notification will appear in your CalCentral, My Dashboard page.

If this does not happen within 36 hours, you may use the department form. This post is for EE and EECS courses only.
I am currently on the website but do not see the SIS form anywhere. Can someone please direct me to the exact form?
I have received 2 override requests so far that would put students over the 13.5 units for Phase I. Please do not fill out the form unless it is within your allowed units for the time period.

The EECS schedulers can only enroll you in EECS courses.

If you're trying to enroll in a breadth, you would have to either use the SIS override form, or talk to the advisors in the other department. (Or drop your EECS course, enroll in the breadth, and then use these forms.)

What about the conflicts with already enrolled EECS classes? I tried to enroll in a breadth, which conflicts with an EECS class that I'm enrolled in; I requested an override on Monday but still haven't got any response.
If you're only on the waitlist for CS170, then it shouldn't stop you from enrolling in 61C.

I am currently far back in CS170 waitlist and do not know if I am able to get enrolled in phase 2, but I also need to enroll in CS61C. Can anyone tell me how to enroll in 61c while keeping my 170 waitlist position?

n/a

You would fill out the CS one though. this post is for EE.
Also, the lab and discussion questions are not mandatory (at least not on the EE/EECS form).
If a class like 170 doesn't have a lab, do we fill out 999 for the lab section or do we put n/a??
Due to the EE16AB bug, I am not processing time conflicts for these classes. I will process them for these classes once the bug is resolved.

history.content:
**This post is for EE & EECS courses only. CS information will be posted when ready.**

Dear Students,

We will continue to override time conflicts for students for this spring. Please see information below.

The enrollment system does not allow you to enroll directly in classes that have time conflicts. This must be processed by the SIS team (instructions). 

If you have filled out the SIS form, but your request has still not been processed after 36 hours, we will override class conflicts for you via a Google form (links below), space permitting. Please note that by filling out the form(s), you agree to have a class conflict overridden for you. It is your responsibility to check the attendance policies and make plans for conflicting exams. You must be waitlisted for the class in which you're requesting to enroll.

Please do not contact us after filling out the form to check on the status of your request. We will process the requests as soon as we are able.

EE Conflict Override Form (use this form for EECS classes as well)

Use the EE form, if you're trying to enroll in an EE or EECS class.

You must meet the enrollment priorities (if any) when you fill out the form in order to be enrolled. There must be space open in your category in order for you to be enrolled.

**Please make sure you have checked your enrolled and waitlisted units. Phase I maximum is 13.5, Phase II is 17.5, and the Adjustment Period is 20.5. We cannot override the maximum units for you and this causes a delay in processing requests.**

Note: If the class is full and/or you do not meet enrollment priorities, you will not be enrolled. If you do not provide 2nd and 3rd choices for secondary sections (if applicable) and your first choice fills, you will not be enrolled.

Please send questions to ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu or lraya@berkeley.edu. I will not be responding to unique scenarios on Piazza.

Sincerely,

EECS Student Affairs

FAQ:

Q: When should I use the form? 

A: After you have first filled out the SIS form and waited 36 hours. Instructions here. The notification takes about 1 hour to appear on your dashboard.

Q: Can conflicts for classes other than EE/CS/EECS be overridden?

A: Not by the EECS Department. See information on class conflicts here.

Q: How long will it take for a conflict to be overridden?

A: We will check the form every few days.
